frameDefinitions: One linguistic unit, Sign_1, has a relation to another linguistic unit, Sign_2.
An Entity aids in the successful completion of a Purpose.
Item-1 and Item-2 are compatible with each other if they can exist or function together in some context without problems, conflict, or other undesirable situation.
This Frame is concerned with evaluating an Evaluee as being suitable for a Purpose or a User, presupposing some choice that is being made about which Evaluee to use for the Purpose or User.
A particular piece of Information is evaluated for its accuracy.
frameExamples: A box is an <t>ideal</t> storage device.
He <t>arranged</t> the elements in the pattern that we now call the periodic table.
Make sure your site is <t>compatible</t> with any browser.
(1) We need to build more houses <t>suitable</t> for local residents.
Is your reputation at risk due to <t>incorrect</t> information?
listRoleDefinitions: FN: a linguistic unit that carries semantic, phonological or syntactic information.
FN: a linguistic unit
FN: Linguistic units
The item which is useful for some purpose.
The kind of task which is promoted by the use or presence of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
When the <fen>Entity</fen> is useful for a <fen>Purpose</fen>.
The person who causes the <fen>Theme</fen> to be in a particular <fen>Configuration</fen>.
An entity that consists of  parts which can be put into a configuration relative to each other and/or relative to their environment.
A state that holds of the <fen>Theme</fen> or a relation that holds among the constituent parts of the <fen>Theme</fen> as a result of the arranging action.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the arranging takes place.
The Frame Element <fen>Item_1</fen> marks the grammatically more prominent of the two entities, i.e.the subject in active clauses, when they are expressed separately.
The Frame Element <fen>Item_2</fen> marks the grammatically less prominent of the <fen>Items</fen> when they are expressed separately.
This role is used when the <fen>Items</fen> are expressed jointly in a phrase, either a plural or a coordinated NP.
This Frame Element is used for expressions that indicate a <fen>Parameter</fen> or respect in which the <fen>Items</fen> are said to be compatible, not in conflict.
This Frame Element marks constituents expressing the entity that is judged to be more or less suitable for some <fen>Purpose</fen> or <fen>User</fen>.
This Frame Element marks constituents that express the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is judged to be suitable or unsuitable.
This role marks expressions that indicate a <fen>User</fen> to whom
The <fen>Information</fen> matches or does not match the facts of the world.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the agent who holds the correct/incorrect information.
The event which communicates the <fen>Information</fen>.
The Topic about which the Source has accurate information.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Information</fen> or the <fen>Source</fen> is correct.
listRoleExamples: In one sense, <fex>dog</fex> is a hyponym of itself.
In one sense, dog is a hyponym of <fex>itself</fex>.
<fex>That technology</fex> turned out not to be compatible with the existing devices
My computer is not compatible <fex>with my new printer</fex>.
The two applications are compatible <fex>in their essential features</fex>.
Being a project leader is not a job for which <fex>everybody</fex> is suited.
We need to plan more buildings suitable <fex>for disabled people</fex>.

the first three months of that year
Mexican Records of the American Southwest: A Bibliographic Guide to Archive and Manuscript Sources
